When there's one item on the menu, you better believe they get that right. Your only choice is "How would you like that cooked?". I picked medium rare, but the waitress informed me that this is cooked in the French style and medium would equal my idea of a medium rare.
A salad was delivered first, which was greatly appreciated! The salad was a really nice, light touch to what would be a heavy hearty meal. Then the steak arrived with french fries, both which melted in your mouth.
For dessert, we ordered the tower of ice cream and meringue (i forgot what it was called) and the profiteroles. The latter was my favorite of the two.

2781.review: Excellent steak. Love the "Secret Sauce" great service. Opens at 1800. Be there early or stand in line.

2782.review: Excellent food. Perfect salade, perfect steak, sauce and fries. 4 stars and not 5 because you can't book and the queue can be horrendous.

2783.review:
Melt in your mouth steak L'entricote with that classic sauce they do. I don't know what exactly is in it, but always ask for an extra pot on the side it's so damn good. 
Just when you think you've devoured it all, they come back with a full second portion of all this too. Ohhh seconds?? Yes please.
All this is after you enjoy a wardorf salad as part of your main, which is fab too.
This place has a few restaurants around town as well as NYC and Paris were it originated from. With one thing on the menu, sit back, order a glass of red wine and wait for the sensory delights to arrive (twice). It's consistently good whichever branch I've been at (note- I once went Canary Wharf and they had 50% off at weekends).

2784.review:
"WOOHOO! AS GOOD AS IT GETS" definitely describes this place. A friend first brought me here on a cold day where we ended up waiting 20 minutes for a table. But I came back the following week with friends, and then again with my family, until we figured out it was best to come before it opens to be the first wave of customers in. And then it became a regular thing with anyone visiting, ever. Or any catch up, or any birthday celebrations - yes - we're going to Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote for dinner.
The experience starts with a mouth watering walnut salad with this yummy sauce, but the unspeakably good star of the show is the sauce that comes with the steak. Let me rewind a bit and say that steak and fries is all you're gonna get. You tell the waitress how you like it (blue, rare, medium or well done - there is no in-betweens), she writes it on the table and off she goes. When it comes out - you are presented with a plate of delicious steak and fries to mop up all the excess sauce you manage not to cram in on every single bite. 
I was so shocked the first time I came here because, as normal, I finished my meal in record time still lusting for more. AND MORE THERE WAS. The waitress comes back with the SECOND HALF (?!?!) of your meal, the steak that was still in the kitchen so that it won't go cold, and an extra helping of fries. Lord have mercy.
And once you think you can't go on, you have a look around and get massive food envy as all these delicious looking desserts start piling out. Now, I don't speak french so you're just gonna have to figure this one out on the menu yourself but the MUST orders are the profiteroles (which I usually don't like, but these are filled with vanilla ice cream instead of cream and are DELICIOUS!) and this stack of ice cream, meringue, praline, amazingness.
This place is definitely a 10/10 in my books!

2785.review: I don't understand what the whole fuss is about: we waited in the queue outside (or in American term: we waited in the line!) Then we were served two small portions of steak with a special sauce but frankly speaking I had much better steaks but the fries was great. The waitress was super serious and when we asked to have our photo taken, she commented that if it is quick! I know it is hectic but a photo at most takes 10 seconds! Anyway, I don't think I will go back here.

2786.review: I was told rare is bleeding but what I really got was medium rare, no blood, and the famous sauce that was really just supplementary rather then complimentary to the very mediocrely cooked meat...

2787.review: This place had only our reserved table free when we arrived, it was packed and I understood why after we ate! The menu is set and in my opinion, perfect. They start you off asking how you like your meat and then bring you a little tasty salad with a mustard vinaigrette. Shortly after you finish your salad they bring you a plate with a semi small amount of steak in peppercorn sauce and fries. Don't worry about the size! They come around after you've eaten your way through it with plate refills of fries AND steak! I was full from my first plate (looks can be deceiving with size! Eyes bigger than stomach!) I can say without any doubt this is the best steak I've ever eaten. It was cooked perfectly and the meat was flawless, zero gristle to trim and full of flavor. I had a delightful Peruvian beer with dinner and creme brûlée for dessert - my man had a small bottle of red wine. The waitress was friendly and checked in with us a few times. I dream of this meal!

2788.review:
Intimate and vibrant french restaurant that serves up only one dish, which is steak and frites. The cut is "La Entrecôte" which is the cut from the ribs.
You only need to make two choices:
1. What to drink?
2. How you like your meat prepared; rare, medium or well
After that it is cruise control. The meal starts with salad dressed with a mustard dressing and bread. Next comes the delicious steak and frites. The surprise is the second serving of both steak and frites. That put a smile on my face.

2789.review:
Yes, it hit the spot!  Simple and Delicious steak and frites! That sauce is A+
Highlights:  Steak cooked to perfection with generous portions of frites...plus SECONDS! Reasonably priced, Good and fast service all inside a nice, clean and big dinning area.  Also, desserts are awesome.  
Can improve:  Take reservations and Give Ketchup or Tomato Sauce.
Benchmark:  I am not a big steak & frites guy and even I found it irresistible.  They set the steak & frites benchmark in my book.
Word of advice:  They don't take reservations so go early when they open for dinner around 7 pm and you should have no problem getting a table.
Dined in April 2016 and will definitely return.

2790.review: We arrived when they opened and got right in.  The service was excellent and the food was delicious.  I loved that I didn't have to decide what to eat, just told them how I like my meat cooked and they take it from there. The salad was fresh and delicious, they provided bread which was crispy on the outside and soft inside.  The steak was perfectly sliced and done to my liking. The sauce was amazing, and the fries were perfectly cooked.  They even offer you a second helping if you want. For desert we tried the Le Vacherin du Relais, it was layers of meringue and ice cream topped with hot chocolate and whip cream - it was incredible. I wish they had a location in Los Angeles where I live.

2791.review: Great restaurant experience here. Excellent service, perfectly cooked steak and delish crispy French fries. We had the house red wine which was also very good. They have a location in New York too that I want to try :)

2792.review:
Le Relais de venise only does one thing, but it does it well: steak frittes. On being seated, the server will ask how you want your steak cooked - if you're vegetarian and/or have a nut allergy, this is your opportunity to shout. The green salad brought to you before your main has walnuts on top, but if you ask for them to be left off, it's not a problem. What may be a bigger problem is that the chips are cooked in groundnut oil - if you have a peanut allergy, you will starve.
I believe vegetarians can substitute their steak for a lot of cheese, but it's an expensive option. £24 for steak frittes or £24 for fromage frittes with a dessert. If you're a veggie, I just wouldn't bother.
The steak is brought to you in two parts, which effectively works out as two giant plates of cow and chips, so it's a big undertaking. My advice is to skip lunch because if you can't finish the main, you will be disappointed with yourself.
The desserts are around the £5/£6 mark and are nice (the crème brûlée is a reliable offering) however you will probably be too full to manage one. House wine (around £5 a glass, £10 for a carafe, £20 for a bottle) is drinkable enough.
You can't book a table even if you're a group, so eat early (5.30pm) or expect to queue out the door. Although tables are a little close, that's because there are a lot of people who want to get in and don't mind sitting on their neighbours.
All in all, this isn't a cheap meal, but it's a substantial one, cooked well.

2793.review:
This is my second time here for dinner. I won't say the food isn't good but what I can say is the service is really a DISASTER! 
One girl who served at our table always put on a shit face and was very rude. We had four people here and she was keeping pushing the table to my friends side which made them really uncomfortable, and she didn't say anything about that. Apart from that, my friends went shopping afternoon so they had some big bags, in case that those would block the aisle, they saved their belongings temporarily at the cloakroom. When we about to leave and asked staff to get the stuff back, one girl just stared at us with very disgusting face and chose to ignore us.
So, if you want to experience this kind of world standard shit service, please come here, I bet you've got little temper to lose here.

2794.review:
YES! FINALLY A RESTAURANT THAT COOKS MY STEAK THE WAY I LIKE IT! 
(sorry for the all-caps intro, but I'm just so happy!!)
So, anyone who, like me, likes their steak rather under than over and is getting tired of the whole 'the least we can cook it is medium rare' bullsh*t, head to Le Relais de Venise. 
But with the food being so good and the whole thing being VERY good value for money, you'll most probably have to queue. Though chances are I'll be in the queue too, so maybe we can have a little chat then?

2795.review: It's one of those London things.. although not exclusively. Sauce is delicious. Meat is good quality. Salad is yummy too! No nonsense place for a fun casual meal.

2796.review:
My first Le Relais experience was in Paris where I accidentally walked into that restaurant. And I enjoyed that experience. When I learned that there was another version in London, I had to make sure I had to bookmark it on my trip here.
Walking in the London version, it even feels like you're in Paris. The tables are very cramped and that you are literally right next to another stranger only inches away. So you need to pull out the table to move around.
And just like the Paris versions, there are no menus. Just steak and frites with a small salad in the beginning. But it's the sauce that makes this place standout compared to other steak joints. It has a nice, tangy vinaigrette flavor that only this restaurant can provide. The steaks by themselves are just normal steaks, served in only "Rare" or "Medium." Even "medium rare" is not allowed. Again, just rare or medium here in London.
And just like the Paris version, you get your second serving shortly after you finished your first plate. 
And as for the dessert, you may need one of the French waitresses to help you out since the menu is in French. But I went with the Profiteroles au chocolat. Nice warm chocolate smothering some vanilla ice cream with shaved walnuts. Now that is a great way to finish the meal.

2797.review: The steak was excellent. I loved it. The fries were excellent--very crisp without being dry and not too fat. The sauce was probably the best part about it, however. I feel like I've gotten comparable steak and fries elsewhere, but the sauce really brought the whole dish together. It really makes you wanna go back for more and more! I will say, however, that I've had better steak elsewhere. I may have a skewed view, though, because I had a really intense conversation with relatives while eating there and was somewhat distracted. Overall, though, this place was amazing! I'd totally come here again if I am in the neighborhood.

2798.review:
Excellent, faultless meal.
The service was attentive and efficient, but most importantly -- savvy. We all know they're trying to get customers through quickly (this place must make a FORTUNE!); however, I never felt even a little rushed. Everything was perfectly timed to allow us to enjoy a relaxed meal.
The house Bordeaux is super drinkable, not overly tannic, and well-balanced (even if slightly lacking in depth), with a seemingly minimal price markup for a bottle. 
What you get is what you come for. Delicious steak and fries. It's an excellent and simple meal perfectly executed. What more does one need to say? 
Show up early if you don't want to wait, otherwise, expect to wait!

2799.review:
I was meeting a girlfriend for lunch and she wanted to go to Le Relais de Venise.  I was excited because it's in my neighbourhood and I've been wanting to check it out because I've heard great things about it.
Food: There's no menu.  They only serve steak frites and as much as you want of it.  They will ask how you would like your meat cooked.  They then start off with a simple salad, the steak comes in small slices, frites and a wonderful sauce that makes you want more.  Very simple.
Drinks: We ordered one sprite and tap water.
Price: 56.10 GBP for two people.
Ambiance: The restaurant feels like a true bistro in Paris.  It was very crowded and bustling for lunch.  It's first come, first serve and they will not seat your party until everyone is there.  
Service: This is why I gave three stars.  Here's where everything went wrong.  The service was horrible.  Our server was a woman who seemed like she hated her job.  She didn't have the time of day for us.  She was very unfriendly, curt, rude and kept bumping into my girlfriend's chair without even saying I'm sorry.  There was a table next to us that was empty and when they were about to seat two people she looked at the diners, said "oh sh*t" and then slammed down the cutlery and glasses onto the table.  The icing on the cake was when she was serving me the frites and dropped one in to my water glass.  She didn't apologise or even come back to replace my water.  I waited for 10 minutes, asked for a new glass of water only to find her very annoyed.
Would I go back?  Maybe.  I wouldn't rush back and if I did go back I would definitely not sit in the section of that server if she's still there.

2800.review: Love this place. No choices, just a question of how you want your steak cooked. Amazing salad; a few wine choices. This is the epitome of do one thing and do it well.

2801.review: One of the best restaurants in the chain compared to other locations. Always good prompt service and the food is great. You know it's good when there is such a line outside waiting to get in, so it may be better to turn up a little bit earlier than you want to eat, just in case.

2802.review: The steak was good but not as good as some of the other locations. The restaurant was crowded and the service staff did not care much. We went quite early so even though they don't take reservations we were able to get a table fast.

2803.review:
They only have one entree on the menu and that is steak. When you get there, you are asked, how do you want your steak. So the only other decision you have to make it is what to drink and what dessert to order. 
They serve a good, fresh and healthy salad. Then comes the most sumptuous steak ever. Melt in your mouth, flavourful steak, with chips (fries). When you are done, they bring you a second serving of steak and chips.
Amazing food, fast efficient service, and very affordable. One of my favourite spots in London, as well as in Geneva. 
Be prepared to wait in line as they don't accept reservations. I have stood in line on weekdays as well.

2804.review: It's a good dinner but just prepare to wait in the long line around the corner. It's all you can eat so you do get some bang for your buck. I do think there are better places  to get steak. The meat wasn't particularly good and the tight tables are a bit claustrophobic.

2805.review:
I hate decisions.
So, you can see...that means I quite love Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecote (especially when a colleague selects it, and the time) -- even though I can scarcely remember the ordering of its name. 
I assure you though, once you've been -- you'll never forget! 
To do but one thing so well, is sometimes as magical as the green sauce the steak and chips come drizzled in. What LRdVLE lacks in choice, it makes up for 10-fold in quality. 
You'll get this, my pretties: 
1. Steak. (the ONE option is -- "how would you like this cooked?")
2. Salad. 
3. Chips. 
4. Greeeeeeeeeen sauce. 
In perpetuity. Served by lovely French people in trim black and white uniforms. 
Quite fabulous for a business lunch (though it does fill up quickly) -- as you'll not be waiting around for everyone to make decisions and can be back to your office swiftly. The guesswork has been removed. You'll be having steak. And salad. And chips. And that green sauce everyone moans about for days and days... 
And if you're like me, you'll be thrilled. Yum. So French and so disciplined. 
*no reservations. 
*great deals at their Canary Wharf location, ask the servers.

2806.review: There is only one thing on the menu, apparently that's a bit of a trend around London right now (see Burger & Lobster). Delicious steak and frites, which also comes with a starter salad. The steak sauce is super buttery so prepare for a post meal coma. Also neat how they serve your main in two portions so the second half stays hot, thoughtful!

2807.review:
Bloody Hell (for lack of a better commonwealth expression, I apologize), this place is fabulous!
I arrived at 6pm (when they open for dinner) sharp after attending the theater, and the line was already one block long!  We were the last group to be seated snagging the final open table, and we had a minimal wait of 10 minutes.  If I had to wait 45 minutes, I would have done it gladly.
Intriguing fact number 1: There was no menu. I was so confused. My date (sister in law) was getting the giggles off the bat watching me trying to piece together this culinary puzzle. A lady came to take our order, simply asking how we liked our meat. Strange, what if I wanted fish....? I said rare, and then she took a marker to my side of the table with a large "R" (clearly it is paper table cloths!) 
Intriguing fact number 2: Then they brought out a salad. I didn't ask for a salad, but I certainly didn't send it back!  Butter leaf lettuce with walnuts and a mustard vinegrette. It was so simple and yum! 
Then the waitress came to the table and served me beautifully butterflied steak strips with a green sauces and hot chips.  The chips were long, skinny and crunchy!  And the meat, well, it was one of the best meals I've ever had. The meat is imported from Scotland, and it is in a league of it's own!!!  Intriguing fact number 3: I got my entree, twice! Oh yes, what is better than one delicious meal? Having two helpings of it! SO don't worry when you polish off your plate.... more is coming!!!
Head out there (early) so that you can roll out of there like I did, content and happy as a clam. I wish we had one of these in Nor cal because I would be there all the time!!!

2808.review:
You ever meet those people that are really, REALLY good at one thing? Like, you have that roommate you went to school with who knows trivia from "The Matrix" movies better than anyone, or there was that girl you crushed on who could mop the floor with anyone on Wednesday nights when the local pub is having trivia for the week and the theme is H.P. Lovecraft and you're both impressed and terrified? This place is like your friend, only they are incredibly good at serving steak and fries. Oh, and being awesomely personable. And being able to tolerate a table of out-of-towners (from Texas, to boot) with the patience and sass of someone who can easily blend patience and sass while also convincing me to have not one but two scotches after a bottle of wine. Yes, this place and the staff are that good.
We arrived around 8:00 on a Friday night per the recommendations of the locals. The place is a small restaurant with a line wrapping around the corner and extending back into a corner of an alley where you can look up at the guy living in the apartment across from the place who methodically paces while on the phone and organizes his shoe collection (sorry guy who lives across the place - but your shoe collection is boss). There's a reason people are willing to wait 45+ minutes in the cold and rain for this place. And if you're still reading this review, you're about to find out why.
We probably waited around 25 minutes, but we got lucky. A professional and polite hostess greeted us at the door when our turn in line had come and we were walked to a table in a crowded dining room. Let there be no doubt: L'Entrecote has figured out how to maximize their space and the maximum occupancy here is probably 6,000 despite being the size of my hotel's lobby. You'll be making new friends at your table, such as the traveling couple next to us who were absolutely sweet, so if you're shy, you may need to get over that real quick.
Our waitress came over and took our order and immediately panic sunk in. No "medium rare" steak?! Send me back to Texas where our beef is still moo-ing when you cut into it! Turns out there was nothing to fear as the "medium" steak was heavenly. My advice would be to placate the salad beforehand and save room for the main course. Don't get me wrong - the salad may rock your socks off but the steak and fries will also send your socks to the cleaners and bring them back with a complimentary breath mint. 
The whole place operates on a "steak and fries are our entrees" menu, and there's a reason: the sauce. If you've tasted their sauce and found it anything less than a miracle on your plate, please book a trip to the local funeral parlor because you clearly were born without a soul. I went back for seconds, another in our party went back for thirds. Add all this up on our bottle of red wine and you have a meal fit for anyone who plans on eating themselves into a coma. This doesn't even take dessert into consideration, with the absolute best profiteroles I have ever had. Bonus tip for those of you still reading: get a round of scotch (or two, in my case) with the profiteroles. Not only will the sweetest bartender in the world deliver them, but you will find out that this is a combo no one can beat without some serious effort.
Speaking of the sweet staff, everyone working here is an undercover angel. I'm convinced of it. I never call out staff in my reviews but our server, Asia, was phenomenal. She not only put up with our relentless questions and my request for scotch after wine and port, but she did it with a level of quick wit that immediately endeared her with all of us. The team here helps each other out, with one girl removing empty glasses deftly and naturally, the bartender delivering scotch with a divine smile, and the food runners polished and focused on their destination. Make no mistake, the reason this place operates as efficiently as it does is because of the immaculate workers under the roof.
Sure, you can knock on them for wanting to turn a table quickly to get the line out the door moving, and you can complain about the limited menu. Doing either of those is providing a grave disservice to this establishment, a hearty dining option filled with delicious food, professional staff and a diverse enough dessert menu to ensure you need to come back. And if this is your first time eating here, I genuinely envy you and what you are about to experience.

2809.review:
After a little confusion about whether this was an all you can eat place (it isn't), a group of 8 of us headed here for dinner while in London. After looking on Yelp I was really worried about just how long we'd have to queue for but thankfully on a Thursday if you arrive around 6 - 6.30, you won't have to wait at all. Score!
We were seated at a large table and they quickly took our orders - I mean, super quickly. The only thing available is the steak and chips (with a salad to start) and they simply ask how you want it done. Options are blue, rare, medium and well done. I went for rare as I figured this being their speciality it was better to go for less cooked than over cooked. 
I didn't particularly enjoy the salad starter, to be it was just a normal kind of salad with dressing. There was also bread on the side which again, didn't win me over as it was just a standard kind of baguette. When the steak arrived though, I was in heaven. Lovely and pink with a delicious gravy kind of sauce and a good portion of chips. I quite like that they served your meat in two goes although I'm sure the second portion that was served to me was my workmates order of blue steak as it was a hell of a lot more bloody than my first portion (that being said, I still ate it). 
Service here is weird - they are all aloof and abrupt. I didn't realise we were still in those days of service, I thought that died along with Gordon Ramsay's popularity in the early 2000s. Stuffy, unfriendly service is never going to win me over no matter how good the food is. If the staff were a bit more upbeat and accommodating this place would have been upgraded to 5 stars for sure.

2810.review:
If there is a crowd waiting outside, do not fret! The service is extremely quick. 
If you like steak and frites, come here (because this is all they offer).  The salad has a simple mustard dressing.  The steak is covered in a green sauce that is amazing. The frites are fried to perfection. :)

2811.review:
I visited the restaurant last night with a group of people 
I've been a huge fan of L' entrecôte for many years, I hadn't been since 6-7 years 
Service was poor, the waitress didn't speak or understand much English, the fries were cold and soggy, the meat was cold. We complained & returned the plates. Second time around they were a little better but nothing like 6-7 years ago. It was not worth the 45 min wait outside & I will never go back. So sad I always dined at the L' entrecôte  here and in Paris every time I visited. 
They have become negligent because of their popularity

2812.review: Worst service have seen in years. Abysmal. Food swimming in dressing. Major disappointment

2813.review:
I was pretty excited to come here because of all the great reviews but it was just ok. There was a huge line and it was crowded but I don't understand why.
 The menu is just steak and fries with no variations at all. My husband didn't like it at all because the steak just tastes like the sauce, and he is a fan of the true taste of the steak itself which a good chef can bring out. He also didn't like the sauce that much. I like sauce more than he does so I didn't think it was so bad, but it still wasn't anywhere near as great as these reviews make it out to be. It was just a steak that was slathered in an okay sauce and as long as you like that sauce you'll be fine, because that is what everything tastes like.  Not bad but nothing special.

2814.review: The moment we walked into the space we knew it was going to be a great experience. Delicious food, nice atmosphere.  Loved it.

2815.review:
Respect for a place that can make it their business to serve just one entree. There's no "choose from the menu" situation. You're served a plate of salad, a plate of steak and fries, and then another plate of steak and fries.
Steak is a food people are pretty picky about and this places manages to sell only steak and also do it successfully. You can get your cut done any degree of rare-ness and it is properly executed.
The merengue tower dessert is also quite good.
I realize it doesn't sound as classy but it might be more pronounceable (and also straightforward) to call this place Steak, Steak, Frites.
Having visited in Paris as well I can say these people have their stuff done!

2816.review:
Came for dinner with a friend - plan was to eat around 8:30 PM on a Wednesday, but the line was insane, so we went to the pub around the corner, had a pint, came back and the line was gone. We were seated promptly and put in our orders. I was a little hesitant to go to this place as I like my steak a certain way (blue - as in, almost still alive) and it almost always disappoints in the UK (because a steak ordered blue in Britain often comes out as medium rare or even medium - ick! And British people get twitchy if you send food back in restaurants, so it really is rolling the dice). But my friend really wanted steak and this seemed like a good option in the neighborhood.
As others have noted, there are no menu choices - only desired level of doneness for steak. I ordered mine blue. We also got the house Bordeaux, which paired nicely with the food. When the steak came out, it actually was blue! Success! But the plate was so ripping hot that it was starting to convert the beautiful bloody meat to a grey overcooked mess, so I had to be uncouth and evacuate it to the bread plate. The server gave me a "wtf" look and I tried to explain, but she didn't speak English, so they probably just thought I was a weirdo, but whatever. That's better than ending up with overcooked steak.
Overall, it was a reasonably good dinner, but for £24, I could make myself better steak frites. Nice atmosphere, though. I'd say it's worth it if you want a simple, pretty good meal, but it's definitely not worth waiting more than a few minutes. If the line is long, probably better to find someplace else.

2817.review:
This is my favourite restaurant - though the original in Paris trumps this one, bien sur. The food is the same, just as amazing, but the atmosphere is not quite the same as in Paris. They probably treat you a bit nicer here, and ain't nobody got time for that. From the baguette to the walnut salad (the vinaigrette is divine) to the steak-frites with the extraordinary secret sauce, accompanied by the house white or a flute or two of champagne - leave me the hell alone because I'm officially in heaven. 
No seriously, piss off. Ommmmmm...

2818.review:
Le Relais de Venise is the centre of the steak world. There is nothing to decide here, no options, you can either order the steak frites or you will be asked to leave. Seriously, the surly waitresses will throw you out if you don't order the steak frites. You can however, select if you would like your steak cooked blue, rare, or medium.
So does Le Relais de Venise live up to the hype? Most definitely. I'm still dreaming about the secret "green sauce."   At 21 quid for a walnut salad, some bread and 2 servings of steak frites you can't go wrong. That's right, course 1: salad. course 2: steak frites. course 3: steak frites. So worth a visit.

2819.review: This place was awesome from the start. A delicious salad followed by steak cooked to perfection, in a crazy good sauce, served with fries/chips. How could it get better? Seconds!!! :)

2820.review:
My husband and I had dinner here with 2 friends on Monday night. The food was fantastic, I love the simple but perfectly cooked menu - and very reasonably priced. Service was prompt and friendly. I thought the house red wine wasn't great (having eaten at the same restaurant previously I remember it being better the first time).
Will definitely go back!

2821.review:
I start this review with a question. Is there a chance for a single option menu to represent a fantastic option for a restaurant? Le Relais de Venise L'Entrecôte proves anyone that this is indeed possible, besides the first impressions. You are probably going to be waiting in a queue in the cold for a good while, but I can guarantee it is going to be worth every second. 
Steak and fries (as much as you want for the later, obviously not for the earlier) with a wonderful sauce that is their big secret. No one knows what the recipe is, but I assure you are going to be willing for more after you finish your meal. I am not much of salad person, so that is why I am not commenting much about it (they serve before the meal).

2822.review:
After all the hype, it was a bit of a letdown for "affordable authentic French food" and it felt a bit touristy. 
My context: At my local taphouse in a collegetown back in America, there is a Monday night dinner special where I can get a similar quality steak with mashed potatoes for $5 (with purchase of a craft beer on tap). So when I heard that this steak dinner would be an amazing deal and the sauce would be what seals it, I expected more.
What I got (everyone gets) for 24 pound deal = 
*To start: a fairly run-of-the-mill waldorf salad (walnuts, romaine, mustard-based dressing) and half of a French baguette, which was soft but cold and I would have liked some butter to go on it. I ended up dipping it in dijion mustard, as there was a jar of it on the table and I liked the kick 
*Supposed star of the show: Two servings of steak frites (cooked only at rare, medium or well, already slice and covered in a mustard-based sauce) - This might sound like the typical (possibly ignorant) American tourist, but I'm not used to already have my steak cut for me and not being able to order my desired medium rare. The sauce also tasted a bit bland to me. The frites were fine - shoe-string so extra crispy. Overall, this was plenty of food but afterward, I felt unsatisfied so I ordered dessert (rare for me!)
Ultimate letdown - the lemon tarts. I was shocked to receive what seemed like grocery chain store quality dessert as they had rock hard crust that seemed to lack sugar and a filling that tasted more saccharine rather than zippy from citrus (which I craved).
With a glass of the cheapest house red wine and gratuity added on to the bill, my dinner ran closer to 40 pounds total. So I suggest to avoid waiting in line, and instead save your money for street or pub food of similar (sometimes better) quality for a quarter of the cost.

2823.review:
Waste of time and money to be honest. Don't believe the hype - go to Entrecôte in any other city but London puts this name to shame. 
Obviously it took long to be seated but that was expected. So was the subpar service. The food was the only thing we were really there for, and it was thoroughly disappointing. We both ordered medium steak and it came pretty much well done and at room temperature. The sauce was average and they provide a lot of fries but a really stingy portion of meat. The salad was the best part but is the equivalent of what a 5 year old can make with basic kitchen ingredients. 
Apparently the profiteroles are amazing but we were both too disappointed to devote any more time or money to this establishment. 
While it is not steak frites, burger and lobster knows how to perfect its dishes while providing outstanding service. What do you know, it seems possible after all.

2824.review:
I don't know what we were thinking when we strolled over at around 7pm on a Saturday night. The line went out the door and around the corner. We waited patiently for an hour. Believe me, it was worth it. 
They've got the formula down to a delicious science, so there's little room for personalization. They won't do your steak medium-rare, for example, and wine list is pretty much "Red or white?" Still, those are minor inconveniences when the result is so satisfying. The one real misstep was the crazy overload of mustard in the salad dressing. 
This location is ideal: on a quiet side street around the corner from Marylebone High Street. The interior can be a bit loud and more than a bit crowded, but it feels lively rather than annoying. The service is pleasant and appropriately brisk. And they'll wrap up your leftover steak if you just can't move on to Round 2.

2825.review:
I am OBSESSED with this place. I believe they have a few other restaurants across London, I've also hit up the one near Bank, which was fabulous as well. 
No menus, no BS. You get a waldorf salad, steak (sorry vegetarians) , chips and the most incredible sauce you will ever taste. You pay a flat rate (I can't remember exactly how much, I want to say £20) and you can basically have as much as you want to eat. The chips are crispy, the steak is super, and again, let me just say, THE SAUCE. You will dream of this sauce for days afterwards. I think there must be some highly addictive substance in it, because I was getting major withdrawals during the hazy weeks that followed. 
The staff are attentive, the wine is reasonable but good, and it's always a buzzy atmosphere. I'm uncertain of whether you can book a table, but normally the wait isn't too long.

2826.review:
Yes, we had the steak. Yes, we had the fries. And yes, it was delicious. 
It seemed hugely touristed - and a warning - there's nothing on the menu besides steak and fries... So go for that and wine in mind, and enjoy!

2827.review:
It's amazing what you run into these days with a simple "French restaurant" google search.
Le Relais de Venise (which I believe to mean "Over from Venice") is one of those cozy little restaurants neatly packed away in London's many streets and alleys. From outside it looks like a classic French cafe, which sits two minutes away from the city's busiest shopping epicenter (bond street/oxford street). 
I didn't have high expectations for this place despite the many glowing reviews my peers had given it; I quickly withdrew my preconceived notions when the meal began.
We arrived at 6:15 pm (15 minutes before the restaurant opens) - mind you, this is a Tuesday night, not the weekend - and the line of eagerly waiting customers was already curling around the corner. I knew I was in for a treat. It was rather funny once we were seated because I picked up the menu card (see photo) and there was literally ONE choice listed: The walnut salad and entrecote with a "famous sauce." I'm a sucker for guarded restaurant secrets and I knew that must have been the reason why everyone frequents it. The meal is split into "first" and "second" service (first and second helpings) and only costs 23 pounds (~$35).. That's like restaurant week prices back in America. 
The salad was quite simple and leafy. As I savored the tangy dijon flavor of the dressing, I took a minute to survey my surroundings. The waitresses were hustling around taking orders and serving customers. The restaurant had filled up in the first 5 minutes and there were already another 100 people waiting outside. 
Our first serving had arrived and it was a perfectly medium-rare piece of tender beef. Entrecote typically comes from the rib side of the cow, but could also be a sirloin, depending on how it's cut. I digress. The meat could have been a little warmer, but then again they were entertaining a full dinner service and the food came in a timely manner. 
The beef was smothered in the most delicious french sauces I've ever tasted. It wasn't a bearnaise as far as I could tell. And I definitely don't think there was any pepper in it. The consistency was somewhat soupy and the greenish tinge must have been taken from an herb. After several tastings, I feel like it might be basil (perhaps an allusion to Venice/Italy?). The rich, flavorful aftertaste of butter lingered on your palate after every bite -  probably a thickening agent used at the very end. The seasoning was perfect. I also tasted some garlic and maybe white wine? If it's a french sauce, they probably began with minced shallots too, which they later strained out (providing a little sweetness). But what do I know? (see photo). I ventured to ask them, and of course I got "it's a secret."
They gratuitously pile on a load of french fries which sort of adds an extra 500 calories to your meal, but it somehow goes well with the rest of the meat. After all, 'meat and potatoes' is always a fail-safe. When you think you're done, you're surprised to be offered another portion of everything! Each serving of beef is a little smaller than a filet, but overall, it's quite filling. It was indeed very delicious.
We finished the meal off with the Vacherin de Relais dessert; a tower of meringue and ice cream blanketed with chocolate syrup and a dollop of chantilly cream on top. So amazing (see photo). 
I would definitely come here again for this eating experience. You won't be spoiled for choice, but the one thing they offer is a home run. A toast to French cuisine. 
5/5

2828.review: The steak here is the best I have ever had and the service is well timed perfection.  It is also a window into the City business scene and is very buzzy and fun to participate in.  I cannot wait to return.  P.s.  Wines by the glass are all quite good.

2829.review:
Apparently, there is always a really long line here, so I would recommend going on a weekday when it isn't as bad.  When we got there, the line had just wrapped around the corner and we probably waited about 25 minutes to get seated, which went by quickly. 
The menu is fixed and consists of a salad, steak, and fries.  As soon as you sit, a server greets you and immediately asks how you want your steak cooked: rare, medium, or well done.  The bread and butter they set on the table for you is quite tasty but try not to eat too much of it, because you will have a generous portion of food coming your way.  The salad comes with a mustard vinaigrette which was delicious.  As soon as you are finished, they bring you your first portion of steak with fries.  When you finish that, they will bring your second portion of steak with MORE fries.  The steak is served with their "famous" sauce, which was outstanding.  They do have dessert, which looked great, but I was way too full to eat anything else.
Fun:
 They serve your main course in two portions so that it remains hot.  Also, they do have a vegetarian option available!  I believe the vegetarian meal is the salad with some sort of selection of cheeses along with the fries, and your choice of dessert.  Both the vegetarian and meat-lovers meals are only 23 pounds! Not bad for great, quality food.

2830.review:
Loved the salad and the ambiance was nice, however I found the steak... disappointing. 
After all the reviews I was really hoping for something special, but it was just, ok. The green sauce was very nice, however it wasn't something I would go out of my way to get again. Woke up this morning feeling a little queasy from the amount of oil on the fries as well...
It's a shame they don't do the salad with some of the steak slices on top for £10. That would be something I'd come back for. Otherwise... it's off to try the next steak place!

2831.review:
Really don't understand the charm of this place - I did not understand it in Paris and I still don't understand in London... I think it is French, steak and all you can eat French fries at the price of 25gbp is what makes people go crazy. I personally much rather grab a good old Babette and chips for 15-20£ rather than being in this mess..
Also the steak has no crust, could argue this is how French take steaks, the green sauce has hardly any flavour, the meat is under salted... The salad tends to be over dressed - the only charm seems to be fries.. Which for me is a very bad value... 
By the way, this is one menu restaurant, salad followed by steak in green butter sauce with fries.. 
I would easily live a happy life without ever having to go.., by the way, I did not have any particularly bad experience... It is just super crowded, and chaotic for nothing for my taste.

2832.review:
If there's one thing this girl loves, it's a nice steak cooked rare and big ol' glass of red wine. Luckily for me, that is all this place served. My husband and I were in London for a weekend trip, and he had eaten at their location in The City while in London for work, but they were closed that night. SO, we went to this location instead. We arrived at about 7:30 pm on a sunday evening, and there was a line (note: they do NOT take reservations). However, we didn't stand in line for longer than 20 minutes. And, if it's cold (like it was the evening we went, there are heaters outside the building to keep you warm while you wait. 
We sat down, with my husband on the booth side of the table, and myself in a normal chair. The waitress came up and to both of our surprise, pushed the table as far back towards the wall as it would go. At first I thought, well, that was bizzarre. But after I thought about it some more, there are quite a few tables crammed into such a small building. 
Ordering dinner consisted of the following: Hello and welcome. How do you like your steak cooked? Rare. And would you like something to drink? Red wine. Okay, that'll be right out. Easiest ordering process EVER! About 2 minutes later, our salad was brought out with our wine. The other nice thing about this restaurant only serving one type of food, is that your food comes out SO fast. Which pleased my belly, I was quite hungry.
When the steak came out, and I saw a green sauce on top of it. I was a bit wary, as I've had some HORRIBLE sauces (most specifically roquefort sauces). But the sauce on the steak is great. The only thing I didn't like about eating here? There was too much food and I couldn't eat it all. Le sigh. 
I will definitely be going back to this restaurant the next time I'm in London. And just as a tip (at least while I was there), if you check in on yelp, you get half off on weekends at their canary wharf location.

2833.review: I love and live for this place. The service is superlative. The steak & sauce are orgasmic.  The salad is divine. Get a bottle of the house wine.

2834.review:
No reservations and only one menu. It seems like a lot of people really like this place so maybe for me it is just a personal preference issue. I would say the food was okay but I would rather pay 21 and eat elsewhere.
They start with a green salad with mustard vinaigrette topped with walnuts, followed by steak frites, £21
Your meal is servedl in two portions. There is only an option for rare or well-done.
I thought the sauce was pretty good but the meat was slightly tough. Fries were thin cut, crispy, and not too salty.
I really liked their profiteroles but they could have used a bit less chocolate sauce. It was drowning in it.

2835.review:
I came here for my Dad's birthday and my brother had told us all to meet at 6, even though the place opened at 6.30.  So we got there and felt a bit silly that we were the ONLY people standing outside at that time!  But within 10mins, the queue had already started to extend around the corner!
I like me a good tasty bit of rare steak.  And I like me some frites too.  Amazing food!  The sauce on the steak is very yum, and the steak was cooked perfectly.  Being pretty gluttonous I LOVE the fact that there are two servings!
Service is pretty rushed, but given the number of people they have to get to I didn't really mind.  However the staff were all nice and serving seemed to be carried out to military precision.
I like the fact there's no menu, takes the burden away of studying the menu and making a decision. I'd definitely come here again,

2836.review:
There wasn't a line at all when I went on a weekday around 12:30pm. The place was mostly empty with a few people dotted here and there throughout. Service was quick and efficient but not exactly warm and fuzzy. It did fill up in the next hour with people mostly there for business lunch and a few solo female shoppers with masses of shopping bags. 
The meal itself wasn't bad. Steak medium was exactly medium, served with more fries than steak. The sauce looked mustardy and oily and tasted bland. I actually added mustard from the jar on the table to give it a kick. Walnut salad was iceberg lettuce drenched in a bland mustard dressing but had no walnuts. Baguette was near perfect though. A glass of wine came filled exactly to the pre-drawn line. 
Overall, this place was ok but I wouldn't wait any amount of time. Branches in other cities, including the original Paris location are fairly busy but there is usually no wait.

2837.review:
No need to worry about FOMO here, or have menu angst - there is only one single thing you can order - steak and chips.  Probably a good thing there's no choice too as they want you in and out of there as quick as is humanly possible - ain't no time for dawdling! 
So on first impression, I was wondering what all the fuss was about. We were rushed into our seats and order taken within 3 minutes (or so it felt!) There were no smiles or charm but functional swiftness.
Then came the plate. It was tiny. My friend next to me actually said the words "I think I'm going to cry if this is all we're getting." Fortunately, cry he did not, as actually, they give you a small plate initially, then give you a full top up once you're running low, so that the meat is kept cooked perfectly for you and the food stays hot. I've never seen this approach before and it's pretty cool I must say.
The steak comes sliced thinly, with shoestring fries and their special secret sauce on top. The sauce was unbelievably good. Between us, we couldn't figure it out. Somewhere between a gravy and a mushroom sauce with maybe a little bit of pesto thrown in?? 
My only regret was that I ordered the steak as medium (they don't do medium rare which would be my usual order) They offer 'blue', 'rare', 'medium' and 'well done', so in future I would definitely go for rare.
The food really was excellent. It's just a pity you never really feel relaxed in there, and as I said, a smile wouldn't hurt. 
Either way, I'd definitely recommend!

2838.review:
It's salad, it's steak, it's fries. 
I've just come to say that I am a fan of what they do here and considering they serve only one dish, it's amazing how quickly the place filled up over the mid-week lunch hour. Since you can't book a table in advance, we were the first to arrive and be seated at around 12pm. However by 12.30pm almost every table was full of city workers and dwellers. 
For around £21, you get a first portion of salad as your starter then slices of steak and fries, served with another portion of steak and fries. They're certainly hearty portions!

2839.review: Steak is so juicy and good! I was hesitant with the sauce, but it was great. Didn't over power the steak...great compliment. I LOVE how they top up my steak serving after I've finished my plate! I have never experienced a "refill" in London! Well worth the price!

2840.review:
For the concept, the food and the all round experience, I'm giving it 5 stars. To be honest, I really didn't want to give this place 5/5 as so many have before, it's almost a cliche.
I can't add too much that hasn't already been said... get there early, the house red is tasty and great value, the secret sauce really is delicious.
But I don't think this place gets enough kudos for it's dessrts! Let's face it, apart from what you choose to imbibe, your dessert option is the biggest decision you'll make all evening! It's a long list and we plumped for 4 of them to share. Their cheese selection was very good and the profiteroles tag-teamed with the praline ice cream was a winner.
Loved the unnannounced second serving too! I knew it was coming (Yelp told me as much) and I had a wry smile on my face when my fellow diners announced that the steak was good enough that they could eat it all over again. You should have seen their faces when our waitress started to pile more meat and frites on to their plates. 
Turns out that at L'Entrecote if you don't ask, you do get. I can work with that.

2841.review:
Best. Steak. Ever.
Best. Sauce. Ever.
Best. Frites. Ever.
And really good red wine. Entrecote, if you don't mind waiting in the cold for 30 minutes before hand, is a fantastic restaurant. You're only of course going to get steak here, plus the staff can be a little bit pushy if you take more than your unquoted but obviously allotted time but it really doesn't matter - the steak is that good. The sauce is incredible, and no matter how many times I go I still get excited and tell any newcomers that they'll be getting more steak than they think, with a conspiratoral wink.
I've only been on Tuesday and Wednesday nights, but even then the place seems very busy, so I'd hesitate to say that 30 minutes is the longest you're likely to be waiting, but it really is worth it.

2842.review: It is definitely "as good as it gets". I thoroughly enjoyed my meal from start to finish. And for reference, I ordered my meat rare, had a glass of bordeaux, and had creme brulee for dessert. Highly recommended!!

2843.review:
I went here a couple of weeks ago for a work lunch and I was very impressed - the only reason for not giving it a 5 star review is because this girl is not a huge steak fan, though I could perhaps be swayed with future efforts. 
On arrival you are presented with bread and a simple, very simple salad. Then after choosing how you want your steak cooked, usual options, not long after it arrives cooked in the most divine - and secretive! - sauce ever along with a heavily heaped portion of frites. I highly recommend the house red to go along with this too, we loved it and it goes really well with the meal. When you are reaching the end of your meal, they come along with some more slices of your steak and even more frites if you require these! 
Three out of the five in our party chose desserts and we were all impressed, I had a lovely praline gelato which I recommend.  
I would definitely recommend a visit here especially for a special occasion or a formal meal. The service was quick, efficient and friendly too making it even more of a winner. 
Located on the very trendy / sauve Marylebone Lane, just off the High Street it is convenient for walking and / or public transport due to its close proximity to Oxford Street and Baker Street.

2844.review:
It's been years people told me to come here, to experience their wonderful steak and their wonderful sauce and their wonderful whatsoever.
Did I finally do it? Yes. Did I enjoy it? No. Plain. Simple.
As Everybody else said (and I mean every other 136 reviews), one choice salad, steak, fries. Stop. Strange, I was prepared for it, ok, Cool.
There is ALWAYS a queue in front of the place, on the weekend it could last for more than an hour, maybe even two. Luckily the place is REALLY crowded, otherwise there would probably a queue from there to Westminster. Ah when I mean crowded I mean SERIOUSLY crowded. I'm slim and I spent my whole time squeezed up in my seat, basically if you are more than 90 kg you'll have serious issues in finding a place here.. Maybe you are filling the place too much, you damn french business with an italian name!?!
Ah BTW, this is a french place with an italian name where most of the waitresses are polish, we had peruvian beer and english steak. Funny, for a place pretending to be french. Whatever.
Now, the meal: first is the salad, well, wow, IT'S A DAMN SALAD WITH WALNUT AND WALNUT OIL, get over with! I mean why should I even care in having such a thing? It's just a basic salad, no preparation, nothing: the pieces are even a bit too big for a salad, and there is nothing interested in it.
Then it comes the steak. Drum rolls, trumpets and bla bla. Well, nothing special. I mean seriously NOTHING SPECIAL.
The steak is good, but not that good (Wanna experience a serious steak? go to hawksmoore, THERE YOU'LL HAVE A DAMN STEAK). It comes as a "tagliata" (don't know the english name, sorry), basically it's already cut in slices, which is a very dangerous thing to do, as the meat will be cut somewhere and then put on the plate (actually it makes two movements after, from the cutting board to the tray and from the tray to the dish). Result: dry steak of course, as every bit of juice has been left over the two past surfaces. I mean there are serious errors, and they are making the strong points over that, how is it even possible!?!
Yeah theoretically the dryness of our tortured piece of meat will be covered by the sauce. Now, the sauce is said to be "the best part". No it's not. It's a bit blend, basically it's just a fatty buttery sauce with mustard and pesto, that's it. No inspiration, no soul, no feeling. Just the usual blend sauce you'll find next to the roast in any self service in every hotel in the world. Ouch.
I don't even want to speak about the fries, they are just fries, whatever. My dog can prepare it. And I don't even have a dog.
So why the two stars!?!?
RESURRECTION
INSPIRATION
HERE COMES THE DESSERT.
Yes baby, bring it on that juicy profiterole! Aaaah the profiterole , you bloody bastard! awesomely sweet on the inside, deliciously bitter on the outside, a real chocolate sauce covering splendid bigne' filled with creamy gelato. Awesome, just DAMN AWESOME.
If this place will even allow me to have just the profiterole avoiding that piece of boredom before, it'd deserve 5 stars. No, it'd deserve 6 stars, 7 stars, at least a galaxy.
LONG LIFE TO THE PROFITEROLE. HALLELUJAH.

2845.review:
Ordered: Steak and Pomme Frites
Price: about £30 including drinks
Review: Gets to the business. Steak: Done. Chips/Fries: Done. Sauce: INSANE IN THE MEMBRANE! Get on it folks. The London L'entrecote and the Paris L'entrecote are a tour de force. Not the same style as Goodmans, Hawksmore, etc. But deliciousssss

2846.review:
Sometimes you don't need a lot of options one good option will suffice. That would be the case here, steak and fries but its amazing. Usually I would say getting steak in London is like eating sushi in Ohio However, these guys have a nice thing going.  I don't think they take reservations and I think you actually want to go when they are busy as they plan accordingly. 
I don't know when the line forms but its long and it takes a while so I wouldn't go if your in a hurry.

2847.review:
I came to this restaurant reluctantly as I am a vegetarian and L'Entrecôte is known for the steak frites. There is not a menu, you simply state how you want your meat cooked and that is all. I specified that I wanted a vegetarian order. And I'm not going to lie I was a BIT worried. I had no idea what was going to be on my plate.
I was brought a simple salad with mixed greens, walnuts and a "secret" mustard dressing, which was delicious. Then they brought over the most massive, beautiful platter of assorted cheeses I have ever seen. I was able to select a bit of each cheese, which came out to be about 6 different cheeses, and quite large portions at that. From the brie to the roquefort, each one was DIVINE. Needless to say, I was the happiest camper. With my cheese, greens, and delicious glass of red, I was in heaven.
And for those of you that do in fact eat meat, this is obviously the place for you. You do not only get one portion of steak, but they will bring you a second serving if you like. Their secret recipe for the green sauce that is put in the steak is incredible, I tried a spoonful. The chips are delicious too and are great for dipping in any of extra special sauce you have left on your plate.
Service is quite good here and they move rather quickly. Be prepared to shout, as the restaurant is quite loud. But it has a wonderful vibe and buzz to it. The puddings menu is quite extensive with tons of options. From rich crème brûlée to lighter sorbet options, there is something for everyone. 
So all you vegetarians out there should never fear the lovely L'Entrecôte. It is definitely worth waiting in the que for.

2848.review:
OOOOOH ERIN L You're from Texas so you know steak so much better than Brits?
Well ERIN, Texas is approximately 3 times the size of all of England, and they produce beef here as well (2 million heads per annum vs 6 million in Texas) and Texas is a big exporter of beef, but England consumes most locally so perhaps Texans aren't that much more fluent in cow than the English?  The numbers suggest there are as many cows per acre here as Texas -- that does sound wrong doesn't it?
Ok all that said, Texas steaks probably are better, but this is a grain-fed vs. grass-fed discussion, and reviewing a French restaurant is probably not the best place to do so. 
A meal at Le Relais is 50% food, 50% some schmuck tourist friend made me stand in a line for a restaurant that only does one dish.  I really enjoyed my last meal there, especially the salad and the fries.  Having recently eaten at 5 Guys, I don't think that is a fair comparison; McDs vs Relaix would've been more apt, as 5 Guys serve those skin-on peanut oil reeking variety which, lets be honest, are subpar to anyone that knows anything about french fries.
I don't recall the room being so tight and the service being so snotty, but perhaps tight is relative to a Texan, you fat pigs -- JOKING, it is a bit tight in there, but as far as service goes, it depends on the server and how busy it is.  
The steak is quite good, though could be overly lean if one is splitting hairs, and I do enjoy the sauce.  That said, there are loads of great new steakhouses in London which might get my money before Le Relais.

2849.review:
It's very simple. There's only one thing on the menu. In fact, there is no menu.
Salad, steak, and fries. That's it. 
AND MY GOD, IT IS AMAZING!!!

2850.review:
My brother- and sister-in-law brought me to this restaurant last week. As odd as the concept is - serving one thing - it really works. 
The salad was just OK, but the steak and fries were divine. The house red paired well with it all. 
It's a lively noisy place and they really pack the tables close together. I didn't mind at all. Good company, good food, and a little buzz from the wine. That's a proper night out if you ask me. 
The lines goes at a fast pace, so don't panic if you see it snake around the side of the building.

2851.review:
Sometimes you want a Heston-type meal, prepared with all sorts of whizzy science-lab-like techniques plated with impeccable artistry on a piece of slate or a board or something that seems stylish at the time. And sometimes you want a well-prepared comforting meal on a plate.
Relais does a good rendition of the latter, serving a well-crafted and comforting meal that always leaves me feeling like my soul has gotten a tiny bit of nourishment on top of the healthy meal I've just enjoyed.
It's decent value and for your money you'll have a good meal. You won't spend a lot of time pouring over the menu because it's basically steak. And frites. They're brought to you in two batches (so you don't end your meal with cold frites) with a highly addictive and mysterious secret sauce. The service could be warmer - they certainly don't aim to connect with you -  but the food itself always seems to tick the boxes, done exactly as it should be done, served in just the right amounts at the right time.
For those of you visiting from the States, I'll leave two comments based on previous reviews and I'll preface those comments by saying I also am from (Gasp! Horror!) Texas.
1. This may seem like an expensive meal because of the exchange rate but actually by London standards it's not and is actually great value.
2. You can't compare Relais to places in the states (or in London) that are or sell themselves as high-end. That's not what this place is about. It's a steak frites place, not the latest and greatest high-priced steakhouse. Will Relais serve you the best steak you've ever had? Nope. Will they serve you a well-prepared meal and bring you back for more? Yup.

2852.review:
ZOMG a waiting line at 10p! That's 30 mins before closing time.
Hmm this will be hard to rate but here is my go at it:
3* cut of meat. 
3* The green sauce, my guess, is a mixture of mustard and some green herb that reminds me of a tartier, more reduced curry mussamam for some odd reason. 
4* at my medium meat. Pink with occasional hints of red liquid.
4* for menu choice. Can't beat "the only thing you get to decide on is how you want your meat cooked". Love the simplicity of it.
5* on the way its served. The second serving with the 1/3 meat + fresh extra crispy frites is a great idea. I was getting full but the crunch of the fresh frites made me wanna finish my meal up.
5* on the le profiteroles du chocolate- at my server's recommendation when I asked for something chocolaty thats not too sweet. Its thin choux pastry with vanilla ice cream, drenched in melted dark chocolate sauce and almond slices. (Note: my mouth is drooling as I am writing the description. I want it again!) The sensation of hot and cold in your mouth makes it extra yummy.
6* for cute french maids in french maid outfits with matching cute personalities
6* for service level and the way the servers handled drama. There was an overly boisterous drunk dude that stood up and started clapping at his table. Moments later he fell off his seat, hitting the customer behind me. 3 of the servers came and talked to him. One talked to him, the other two reassured the surrounding diners. 15 mins later, he started banging on the table really loudly several times and was extremely loud in his proclamations. My server went over to placate him. He instantly had his hand around her waist and as they talked, his hand went to her butt! She calmly finished talking to him and deftly maneuvered his hand away. I would have gave him a resounding punch or a kick in the groin if I was in her shoes. 
Anyway.. its a nice experience overall

2853.review:
This place has focused on steak frites and it's great.  You get salad and bread for the starter and then you have a serving of steak and fries.  The only choice you have is how well you would like your steak cooked.  Then, when you have finished your meal, the waitress comes over to give you top-up steak and fries!  The sauce is tasty and I mopped up the rest of it with french bread.
Actually, there are times when you can have choices: the wine list and dessert time.  We had nice glasses of rose and red, but we declined dessert because we were nicely full of steak and fries.
There is a minimum charge of £21 per person, but this is conveniently the charge for the steak frites meal, excluding drinks and dessert.  With drinks, our bill was just over £50 for both of us.  This is reasonable for London restaurant prices and I think we will be back sometime.
Note: you can't make bookings and we were able to get a table right away on Friday night because we got there at 6:30pm.  By the time we left, there was a decent line that turned the corner of the building outside.

2854.review:
I'd been dying to go here for weeks. Tonight all the stars aligned and I landed a table after only about a 10 minute wait. 
In truth, I was a bit disappointed- I expected soooo much more. I suspect that it was my own build up based on reviews than their actual shortcomings. All in all, the steak was good, fries were tasty, and the sauce was interesting... sadly, it was a long way from the best steak I've ever had and odds are, I'd try another steak house before going back...

2855.review:
We never had steak and frites before and you would think that we would head over to Paris first to try it.  Hubby found this place on Yelp and since it was close to where we were heading, we decided to give it a try anyways.
The servers were mostly all french hence the restaurant's name and even though we came right around lunch time, we were able to be seated fairly quickly. 
Just like most of the reviewers, steak and frites is the only thing on the menu.  You let the server know how you want the steak to be done and in a few minutes, you see them bring over trays to the counter and our server started preparing our dish.  
I thought it was interesting that after we were finished with our first dish, she came back again with the rest of our steak and frites to replenish.  It makes us feel like we were in a buffet but then realize that it was just the rest of our steak.  I think I would've been fine having them give it all to me at once but I guess it's the experience.
Most of european restaurants now bring over a portable credit card machine to finish the bill transaction which is good IMO.  Definitely cuts out alot of CC fraud if any.  Although I can't say the same for this restaurant since we felt like we were robbed of our money when the bill came out to be $70 US for lunch.  That's the most we've ever paid for lunch and frankly, I think I would've been ok with a croissant sandwich in one of those takeaway restaurants. 
So yeah, doubt we'll ever come to eat at this place especially when the pounds are so dang expensive compared to euro dollars now.  Oh well, live and learn. =D

2856.review: We are huge fans of the Paris restaurant near Champs Élysées, so we were thrilled to go here in London.  Always go before they open and ljoin the queue.  We happened to be there on a bank holiday and they opened up at 6:30 instead of 6.  We made sure to ask for more sauce and bread to soak it up with, we are not shy- the sauce is so unique.  We ordered the profiteroles and several orders of vacheron.  The vacheron is hands down the best dessert ever!  The tower of ice cream, meringue and hazelnut chocolate sauce is not to be missed.

2857.review:
So I had lunch at this place the other day. I had eaten at the one in New York before, so I had an idea of what to expect.
The very first part of the experience was the worst part. We got there and saw a line out front waiting to get in. Unfortunately, everyone had to wait on it, both large and small groups. This was a bit disappointing since sometimes a party of two can get seated quickly in a crowded venue. Anyway we waited and it wasn't the end of the world.
Once we got seated, everything was great. There isn't much of a selection here as I think the only things you can get as a main are steak and fries. There could be other options, but we were both quite happy to have the steak and fries.
Basically, the server just asks you how you like your steak and then brings you sliced steak and fries. It was quite good.
After the main course we had deserts which were also quite good.
Throughout the whole meal, service was great.
I would definitely come back here, just not at a peak time. It might be a good place for a late lunch as there was practically no line to get in when we were leaving.

2858.review:
Hmmmm, let's see here. The only thing they serve here is beautiful steak (with a crack like sauce), frites, and salad for ridiculously cheap. Then they bring you a second helping. 
Yeah, I'll wait in line for that. Again, and again, and again...

2859.review:
We made a reservation for Thursday evening, and thank goodness we did because the line was snaking out the door.
Once seated, we ordered the £21 prix fixe.  Bread and salad for the table were solid, but we all know we were really there for.  By the time we finished it, we were like sharks during feeding time- stalking the waitress at the corner of our hungry little eyes and hoping she would come around soon to feed our hungry little mouths.
And 5 minutes she returned to the shark pen with plates full of crispy thin fries and six slices of meat doused in green sauce.  I mistakenly asked for medium and I think the medium was actually more medium-well, and the rare was actually medium.  Order rare when asked, please make your experience that much more worth it.
By the way I don't know what they put in that sauce, but it is in-sauce-xicating.  Pun fail, I think so.  I could drink that sauce.
The nicest part of this was that they come around with a second helping.  Surprise- more meat!  Can't complain about that, even if the meat was nothing mind blowing.  That sauce though, I'm coming back for you.

2860.review:
When the paradox of choice leaves you wanting to opt out, trust Le Relais De Venise L'Entrecote to do the decision making for you. The only choice this restaurant will have you make is regarding the temperature of your steak. 
As for wine, make it the house red; great drinkability at a decent price point.
Soon after you place your order a pile of salad will arrive at your table dressed in a light mustardy vinaigrette with half a handful of walnuts strewn over the top. This salad tastes better than its homely appearance would have you believe.
Next comes the steak, doused in a green sauce (don't ask what's in it, the recipe is highly guarded) and accompanied by a pile of fries. But this is only the beginning - one more portion of meat and frites is still to come! Who doesn't love seconds, right?
It's no surprise they do not have ketchup but no aioli either? Mustard was no stand in dipper for my frites and I was left wishing for a bit of mayonnaisey goodness. However, I soon realized that the secret green sauce did the trick. 
Le Relais De Venise L'Entrecote is a lovely little respite from poring over menus night after night in search of what's good. They serve one thing only and they do it very well.

2861.review:
Steak Frites!  Steak Frites!  Steak Frites!  That's all I heard from my local friend about this place.  "We gotta go to steak frites!"  I asked my friend, "is the place really called steak frites?"  "No it's not, not sure exactly the name but we need to get there early to get in line- 5:30PM.  WTF!  
Anyway, after watching the Chelsea/Portsmouth match at a local pub, which shall go nameless, we walked towards Steak Frites!  The build up to Steak Frites! was unbearable.  My friend Sean, kept talking about the one item menu, the salad, the sauce that comes with the steak, the top notch fries, how you can have seconds...etc....  I was salivating- unfortunately we arrived at 5PM and they were not open yet, but we were second line!.  
The brilliant part about this location is that if you get there early, you can go across the alley to the Italian restaurant (which is open), sidle up to the bar and order spiritous libations while you wait for Steak Frites! to open.  Double Jack and Coke, extra ice, keep 'em coming and thanks to Stacy for waiting in line while we went for drinks.  By the way, if you sweet talk the bartendress, she'll put your bev in a paper cup so you can go back across the street and relieve your compatriots.
OK- finally, we were seated and this place was true to the hype.  Cute waitressess in French maids outfits, no menu, just how do you want the steak and how's your wine list- well done!  The salad with mustard dressing was devine.  The Steak Frites! were fantastic!  The sauce- nonpareil!  You will not find a better sauce.  The best part is they keep a second helping on the flame so you can have more-  then you build the perfect bite- a bit of steak, mashed into some Frites! and then dipped in their secret sauce and it is game on!  Fucking Delicious!
How can a restaurant serve just one thing and stay in business.  Well.... just go here and find out.  You will be rewarded!
Oh, by the way, they have dessert too.  Get it!
God bless this place and all the ships at sea!

2862.review:
This is one of those places with cult followings that you just have to check out. A little real London culture.
If you're reading this, you know everything awesome about this place. Yes, the sauce is that good.
BUT HERE'S THE MEGASICKTIP: Generally there's huge lines. like, 1 hour and 15 minutes on a saturday at 7:30 kind of lines. But I found a mini loop hole: go for the first seating (they open at 6:30, so queue up before then) OR go on SUNDAY around 8. At that point there was no line at all.
*NOTE: I saw that they actually do have vegetarian options. It's the regular starter salad, a more baller salad as a main, and a free dessert.
Carry on.

2863.review:
Between this and the Canary Warf location. Come here. Between this location and Paris... Well. Hop on that train to Paris!!
Not much can be said about Relais. It's a sweet n short menu that delivers some good comfort eats. I definitely recommend either medium or medium rare for the steak. And definitely try your luck at getting some extra sauce while you're at it! The desserts are the only part of the experience that you can probably skip on and find better options elsewhere.

2864.review: Fantastic French steak resturant. Unique that it's a salad to start and steak and fries. That's the choice you have and you just say how you want your steak cooked. You must turn up early and wait in the queue. If you are there before it opens and happen to be around 2m round the corner you may just make the first sit in. If you are further then be ready to wait around an hour or so before you get in. So dress well and be prepared.

2865.review:
It's a cool idea to only have one thing on the menu as it makes ordering pretty quick, which is more than can be said for the wait outside. I normally REALLY hate queueing for food in London, as you're never normally more than a five minute walk away from another good eaterie. A twenty minute queue on a Wednesday night in November was a bit excessive in my opinion (but in spite of looking up alternatives on my friend's iPad we stayed the course).
 It was sort of worth the wait, as after a while you just think, we've waited this long we may as well stay. Would I do it again? Probably not.
 Steak was well cooked, the sauce tasty, the mustardy dressing on the salad was very mustardy and with two helpings, I was full.
 Profiteroles were yummy (although extremely cold fillings - not sure if it was icecream) and the tarte citron very good.
 I'm glad I went but for another twenty minute queue it would have to be super special.

2866.review:
I had been meaning to go here for some time, and an impromptu dinner with an old friend meant I finally got my chance.. 
With only a set menu you given the wine list  and desserts to chose from. The simple menu means that what they do cook they cook well, or medium should I say.
My l'entrecote steak was delicious, full of flavour and tender, cut into slices and smothered in a 'special green' sauce. Accompanied by chips that kept being refreshed, yum. The biggest and best surprise of the evening was when I was brought over a second helping of steak! What a place, and all included in the price of the set menu. 
I finished with a creme brulee which tasted just perfect!
I would certainly return, although with wine our bill did come to £70- (for 2) so not somewhere I will be going every week. 
Tips: 
1) Skip the starter salad, save space for chips and beef.
2) Come early or you'll have to queue this place doesn't take reservations.

2867.review:
I would call this place the McDonalds of steak. You get a fantastic deal on steak, salad, and fries. The food is good, but not amazing. 
I won't repeat what the other reviews attest to other than to confirm that: 
1) We waited about 45 minutes in a queue snaking around the corner.
2) There is no main menu. Drinks and desert are extra.
3) Vegetarian (cheese platter) includes desert "free".
4) The green sauce is delish.
Everything is rushed. The interior is loud. Waitresses in French-maid getups quickly serve you food in an efficient manner. Fries are "pre-cooked" (i.e., not made to order) and sit in a large tray waiting to be dished out to you. The house wine was pretty good.
For the steak itself, it is served in slices with green sauce. Americans who like their steak grilled will be disappointed. The steak reminds one of brisket. The steak is good, but again, not awe-inspiring. Don't expect Kobe beef.
The desert was disappointing. I ordered the creme puffs and my friend ordered something resembling stacked macaroons. The pastries themselves were OK, but they were slathered in chocolate.
